div.p: This implementation guide is DRAFT. There are a number of open issues that will need to be resolved before it will be fully implementable and a number of additional clean-up steps that will need to be taken before the guide is published for ballot. A list of known issues follows. If there are additional issues you feel should be discussed/addressed, please raise them on the project discussion stream on http://chat.fhir.org.
These are topics that will require debate and discussion with domain experts to determine how the specification should work. Project calls will focus on resolving these issues.

ol.li: Plans and prescriptions? - is there sufficient difference in value between having an exercise prescription and having a plan that we need to support both?
Exercise prescriptions shareable - While exercise prescriptions are useful, is there a value in sharing them electronically with anyone, or is just printing it all that's needed?

Responsibilities of Service Provider - Can Service Providers store data that is accessible to external systems? Can they push observations to care managers on behalf of a patient? Can they update care plans or goals? If so, do we want to standardize what changes can and can't be made?

Responsibilities of Patient Engagement systems - Can Patient systems store data that is accessible to external systems? Can they update care plans or goals? If so, do we want to standardize what changes can and can't be made?
Responsibilities of patient - Can patient systems update goals and/or plans?

Condition needed - following the Gravity SDOH pattern, they use Condition as the foundation for referrals, etc. The logic is that a formal diagnosis is needed to enable insurance billing. Is that the case for physical activity, or can we get away with just observations? Do either Service Provider or Patient Engagement systems have any use for these?

Intermediaries? - is there a role for intermediaries operating between care coordinators and Service Providers in the same way that third parties function in Gravity SDOH? If so, who would the likely candidates be and what would the business model be?

Feedback necessary? - In Gravity, feedback about satisfaction with service providers is important to both ordering clinicians and payers. Are we confident that the same will be true in the physical activity space? I.e. will systems bother asking for feedback about service delivery, and if so, act on the information provided? How?
Transaction support - Where do we need to support sending multiple things at once in a transaction? Is it better to simply have all of the systems send resources one at a time?

Registry management - The ordering, performing and possibly patient systems will need to have a shared authoritative list of entities that can be referred to, including an ability to filter the regestry entries to those that are 'relevant'. Ideally, we'll be able to leverage the work from [FAST Directory Query IG](build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-directory-query/), though that doesn't cover everything we need. Specific entities that will need to be discoverable and referenceable include:
CareTeam? - if used to represent a team of practitioners with assigned roles
HealthcareService - if used to represent particular capabilities a patient can be referred to
Organization - to identify clinical, social service, and intervention delivery organizations
Patient - the focus of the observations and beneficiary of any interventions
Practitioner and PractitionerRole - specific individuals involved in planning and ordering care or delivering care
RelatedPerson - parents, spouses, neighbors and others who may act on behalf of the patient and/or assist the patient
Of these, neither Patient nor RelatedPerson are covered by the FAST project, so alternatives will need to be explored. For the remainder, will need to confirm which ones will be used and whether we can leverage existing registry endpoints (and get additional relevant practitioners, organizations, etc. exposed and managed via those endpoints).
Subscriptions - Gravity makes use of subscriptions to monitor for changes to orders and tasks. Is that something we want to do too? Doing so requires a larger degree of system capability.

Examples - every profile we have needs to have at least one, and ideally several examples that cover the range of how it can be used. Most ideal of all would be for the examples to interrelate and convey a realistic scenario. We need to gather the scenarios and the detailed data elements that would be shared in those scenarios in order to construct appropriate examples.

Implementation - We cannot bring this specification to ballot until multiple independent systems have implemnted it and successfully interoperated in at least a test environment. Who will implement and who can they test with?

MVP? - Do the conformance requirements reflect the 'minimum viable product' needed by the market with optional elements limited to those that, while not strictly necessary, are still likely to be taken up by a significant proportion of the community?
Should the IG support access to guidelines around "how best to discuss?", "how best to intervene?", "what are common barriers to explore?"
How do clinicians find out what services are available - do we need something more than just registries
Should we flag 'validated' observations (i.e. where a professional was watching, gathered from device)

div.p: These are known deficiencies in the specification that need to be corrected, but which don't necessarily require domain expertise to address. Some of them are technical and relate to HL7 internal processes, so don't worry if you don't understand them all.

Various: Create diagrams to represent information visually where it makes sense to
Explain why we're not using Questionnaires in the way Gravity does
Transaction: Set expectations for support of transaction in measure submission and possibly interventions
Downloads: Remove link to backport IG if we're not using it.
Artifacts: Create complete examples (and possibly ExampleScenarios) for all profiles leveraging domain epxert input
Credits: add list of active project participants
